mdRecord.dcterms:title: Map of the property of the Lexington Development Company at Lexington, Rockbridge County, Virginia August 15, 1891 / by D.C. Humphreys, Prof. Eng. Washington & Lee University, Lexington, Va. ; Engineers Chas. W. Forster & J.W. Link ; Field Assistant J.T. Morgan ; drawn by J.W. Link ; for more information apply to The Lexington Development Company, Lexington, Va
Lexington, an educational centre
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Humphreys, D. C. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map : col. ; 34 x 54 cm. on sheet 41 x 57 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Inset (separate scale, with radial distances): Map showing location of Lexington Virginia. 1890. [original]
Three pictorial insets: Hotel de Hart, Lexington, Va. -- Main buildings of Washington and Lee University. Chartered 1782 -- Virginia Military Institute. Founded 1839. [original]
Separate heading appears lower central map: Lexington an Educational Centre (listing Washington & Lee, Virginia Military Institute and Anne Smith Academy for Young Ladies. [original]
Shows downtown Lexington, plus street names, numbered blocks and lots of the area owned by the Company. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Lexington Development Company (Lexington, Va.)--Maps
